SEARCH
Package com.financial.entries

Class BudgetExpense

java.lang.Object
com.financial.entries.BudgetEntry
com.financial.entries.BudgetExpense
Direct Known Subclasses:
PublicInvestmentBudgetExpense, RegularBudgetExpense
public class BudgetExpense extends BudgetEntry
Represents a specific expense entry within the financial system.

This class extends BudgetEntry and adds organizational context, specifically linking expenses to unique Entities and Services. It provides static methods to aggregate data from both Regular and Public Investment Budgets.

  • Constructor Details

    • BudgetExpense

      public BudgetExpense(String entityCode, String entityName, String serviceCode, String serviceName, String code, String description, String category, long amount)
      Constructs a new BudgetExpense with full organizational and financial details.
      Parameters:
      entityCode - The code of the entity.
      entityName - The name of the entity.
      serviceCode - The code of the service.
      serviceName - The name of the service.
      code - The specific expense/account code.
      description - A brief description of the expense.
      category - The category of the expense (e.g., 21, 24).
      amount - The monetary value of the expense.

  • Method Details

    • getSumOfEveryBudgetExpenseCategory

      public static Map<String,Long> getSumOfEveryBudgetExpenseCategory()
      Aggregates and returns the sum of all expense categories, combining Regular Budget and Public Investment Budget (PIB) data.
      Returns:
      A Map where the key is the category code and the value is the total sum.

    • calculateSum

      public static long calculateSum()
      Calculates the total sum of all expenses across all budget types.
      Returns:
      The total combined sum as a long.

    • getDescriptionWithCode

      public static String getDescriptionWithCode(String code)
      Retrieves the description for a given expense code by delegating the search to the logic service.
      Parameters:
      code - The expense code to search for.
      Returns:
      The description of the code, or an empty string/null if not found.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares this expense with another object for equality. Two expenses are considered equal if they share the same Entity Code, Service Code, and Expense Code (Composite Key).
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - The object to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if the objects represent the same expense record.
